author: sky.cactus
content: This already exists, and people mostly used it just for gas tokens not actually cleaning up state.  It is largely being removed in London.

author: sky.cactus
content: Someone should propose an ETH sweep transaction that allows people to sweep to zero.

author: jgm
content: We can do that with just a standard transfer, no?  Although interestingly EIP-1559 makes it harder to do so, as basefee of the block in which the transactions is mined could be below the max base fee specified in the transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: Well, an expert can, but regular users cannot.

author: sky.cactus
content: By expert here I mean you have to generate the transaction as soon as a block arrives and author it in such a way that it is only viable in the next block.

> I'm not sure if this is the most appropriate place but I'm currently researching the value of a non-Ethereum chain adopting EVM so that it can deploy Ethereum based smart contracts.
